page.title: 04Ickwell 2
page.content: In 1961 Ickwell won the 'Best Kept Village' award. The village in fact has no church or pub,the nearest being in Northill. Once there used to be a communal oven in the village where the people took their Sunday joint to be cooked and collect it on their way home from church. This still stands by the green. In the last 84 years it has lost only 10 buildings which is not a bad conservation record. Ickwell is now one of Bedfordshire's numerous conservation areas,therefore the village is given the county's protection. So Ickwell looks safe from the developers and Ickwell peach looks likely to survive. Visitors will continue to visit and admire and enjoy a quiet Sunday afternoon watching the cricket on the green.
